This can have a broader societal effect by reinforcing the rule of law and discouraging criminal behavior across the population.

In short, the evidence supports the conclusion that the death penalty is a more effective deterrent than life imprisonment. It not only deters potential murderers but also sends a clear signal that society will not tolerate the most serious crimes.
